page.title: 17QUARRIES
page.content: There are three sites of extractive industry in this area. These are Cultoquhey Quarry, Muckleburn Quarry and the gravel pit. All of these are now disused, but in the past they provided the local area with building materials. At Cultoquhey Quarry slate was mined as was the case at Muckleburn. Both these quarries were readily accessible to a means of transportation. The gravel pit supplied a road laying surface locally, but has been closed for a number of years. Although not in use these quarries are still clearly visible and the stone is still occasionally used by the farmers for the purpose of building dry stone dykes or building rough farm tracks.
